# mypy

Python's popular static type checker.

**Note:** You may see files outside the specified path (`-p`) in your outputs. This is because mypy follows all imports, even those not explicitly listed. See the [mypy documentation](https://mypy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/running_mypy.html#following-imports) for details.

```{python}
#| echo: false
#| # pylint: disable=missing-module-docstring
# Import required packages
import subprocess
import sys

# Add parent directory to sys.path
sys.path.insert(0, "..")

# Import the helper functions
# pylint: disable = import-error, wrong-import-position
from helpers import generate_html, print_quarto  # type: ignore # noqa: E402
```

```{python}
#| echo: false
#| output: asis
generate_html(
    pypi_url="https://pypi.org/project/mypy/",
    github_url="https://github.com/python/mypy",
    conda_url="https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/mypy"
)
```

## Run mypy using `lintquarto`

```{.bash}
lintquarto -l mypy -p typecheck_example.qmd
```

:::{.pale-green}
<style>
.cell-output-stdout code {
  word-break: break-word !important;
  white-space: pre-wrap !important;
}
</style>
```{python}
#| echo: false
result = subprocess.run(
    ["lintquarto", "-l", "mypy", "-p", "examples/typecheck_example.qmd"],
    capture_output=True, text=True, check=False
)
print(result.stdout)
```
:::
